decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The remedial works proposed as part of this Listed Building Consent (reinstatement of wall and railings) must be completed within 9 months of the date of this consent and shall be retained thereafter.
Reason: To ameliorate the harm caused by the recent accidental damage to preserve the special architectural or historic interest of the listed building and to comply with the provisions of Section 18 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Condition : 2 - Samples of all external materials and a sample block of brickwork pointing are to be provided to or made available to view on site and photographs of the same are to be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority prior to the implementation of the relevant part of the works.
REASON: To protect the special interest of the listed building.

Condition : 3 - Notwithstanding the details provided in the design, access and heritage statement, the lime mortar for the wall shall be NHL3.5.
REASON: To protect the special interest of the listed building.
description: Variation Of Condition 3 (Mortar) Attached To Listed Building Consent Reference P/2478/20: Rebuilding Part Of Wall And Railings
